mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Feels that the Governor of Kansas is "guilty of a great outrage"; claims that the governor, in his attempt to fill it with democrats, is "destroying" the state; believes the democratic abolitionists are looking to make a "free-state democratic party" with enough power to elect a President; warns Wise to guard the South. Autograph Letter Signed
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1857 July 7, Robert Tyler, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania to Henry A. Wise
